File /obj/handlers/corpse_handler.c

A small handler to keep track of corpses.

Written by Pinkfish

Started Thu Jun 13 17:22:06 PDT 2002

Includes

This class includes the following files /include/player_handler.h

Class Index

corpse_data

Method index

check_corpses()
This goes through the current list of corpses and tries to find them, if not it creates them.
create_corpse(string, int)
This method creates the specific corpse.
deregister_corpse(object)
This method deregisters the corpse from us.
find_player_corpses(string)
Finds all of the corpses for the player.
query_next_corpse_id()
This method returns the next corpse id.
register_corpse(object)
This method registers the corpse with us.
save_corpse(object)
This method will save the corpse data out to a nice file.
stats()

Public Functions

These are functions that everyone can access.

.
check_corpses
void check_corpses()
This goes through the current list of corpses and tries to find them, if not it creates them.

create_corpse
object create_corpse(string name,
int id)
This method creates the specific corpse.

Parameters:
name - the player name to create it for
id - the id to create
Returns:
the new corpse
deregister_corpse
void deregister_corpse(object ob)
This method deregisters the corpse from us. We forget about it and it wombles off into the ether.

Parameters:
corpse - the corpse to deregister
find_player_corpses
object * find_player_corpses(string player)
Finds all of the corpses for the player.

Parameters:
player - the name of the player to find the corpses of
Returns:
the list of player corpses
query_next_corpse_id
int query_next_corpse_id()
This method returns the next corpse id.

Returns:
the next corpse id
register_corpse
void register_corpse(object ob)
This method registers the corpse with us.

Parameters:
corpse - the corpse to register
save_corpse
void save_corpse(object ob)
This method will save the corpse data out to a nice file.

Parameters:
ob - the object to save
stats
mixed * stats()

Classes

These are nice data types for dealing with... Data!

corpse_data
class corpse_data {
int id;
}
